This is a new requirement for the U.S.

Turn phone OFF > Press and hold the DOWN volume and POWER/LOCK keys  logo will appear Release POWER/LOCK and immediately press and hold it again.Factory data reset will appear > Release all keys.Erase all user data & restore default settings  will appear > Use DOWN volume to go to YES > Press POWER/LOCK.You will be asked to confirm Use DOWN volume to go to YES Press POWER/LOCK.Android icon will display.When completed > Phone will reboot automatically.

        Hi MaryNTX. No, it will not be difficult for you to transfer your phone number and remaining service (talk, text, data and service days) from your old phone to the new phone. There are several options how you can perform the transfer. First, you can text the keyword “UPGRADE” to short code 611611. This service will allow you to transfer your phone number and remaining service from one phone to another. Second, you can perform the transfer directly in the TracFone website at www.tracfone.com. Lastly, you can contact our customer service representatives at 1-800-867-7183 for assistance with the transfer process. For your convenience, our representatives are available Monday-Sunday from 8:00 AM to 11:45 PM EST. ^Marvin

        Hi Matthew. Thank you for your interest in TracFone Wireless. Please be informed that you may text "ADD" or the numeric code "233” to short code 611611. This service allows customers to add airtime through 611611 by adding their pins to their current number or another number. In addition, please be advised that there are different ways on how you would be able to buy an airtime plan for your phone. If you wish to buy an airtime plan immediately, you may text the keyword “BUY” and send it to 611611. You may also purchase our airtime plans at www.tracfone.com or by contacting us. Furthermore, our airtime plans can be purchased from eBay (www.ebay.com) or from one of our retailers like Walmart, Dollar General or Target. ^Aphyle

question: Its says 128 gb and by headline and than by the details it says 8gb.  which is right ?

answers.answer: They refer to two separate things. The 128 gb is the ROM (read-only memory) used for storing and saving your files, such as photos, music, documents, etc., while the 8 gb coresponds to the RAM (random access memory) another type of storage used to operate the phone and and its applications.

question: Does this phone have a 64 bit chip in it?

answers.answer: YES.  The Motorola 5G Ace (2021) uses a Qualcomm Snapdragon 750G processor. Here's a good way to test if a device may have a 64 bit chip.   A 32-bit operating system can only support up to 4GB of RAM. However, a 64-bit allows more than 4GB of Ram for the needed increased performance to run certain applications (ex: Pokemon.) Consequently, It also allows you to run not just support  64-bit apps.   I hope this information helps.

If Motorola Support is unable to help and the problem is related to using Verizon may I suggest the following possible solutions (1) Make sure APN is set to VZWINTERNET (2) Call Verizon support directly and asked them to add "CDMA-less provisioning" to your account and activate the phone for you.         If Motorola Support is unable to help and the problem is related to using Verizon may I suggest the following possible solutions (1) Make sure APN is set to VZWINTERNET (2) Call Verizon support directly and asked them to add "CDMA-less provisioning" to your account and activate the phone for you. It should only take about 5 minutes to complete. (3) Request from Verizon a new Sim card instead of using your existing Sim card from your prior device. (4) Switching from an I Phone to an Android phone may require additional Verizon technical support assistance in setting up the new device to accept text/photo messages. I hope this information helps.

When I got this phone, I could make calls, and send and receive texts. Everything was working perfectly, except I could not receive calls. I worked with techs at three different stores, and called tech support several times. I finally got elevated to the highest level of tech support where they work on the issue and te…

        When I got this phone, I could make calls, and send and receive texts. Everything was working perfectly, except I could not receive calls. I worked with techs at three different stores, and called tech support several times. I finally got elevated to the highest level of tech support where they work on the issue and text you when the issue is resolved. It took two days, but finally the issue was fixed. Long story short, it turned out that there was no problem with the phone. It was something wrong with their system. Yours sounds like a similar problem. I would call Verizon and ask to be pushed through to the highest level of support. You can also work with them via chat on their website. Be persistent.
        
          see less
Having the same problem with T-Mobile as well. Certain contacts’ text messages are never received.

Just worked with Verizon tech support on this issue, the trouble was they have to active CDMA-less provisioning.  I don't know why Verizon's system can't do this re-provisioning automatically when there is no CDMA signaling coming from the phone but it's all good now.I am posting this so other people will understand that it isn't an issue with the phone itself and they will have to contact Verizon Tech Support and have the tech activate the "CDMA-less provisioning" for their new phone.

You need to add your carrier's MMS access point name (APN). I discovered that I wasn't receiving MMS right away, and I first tried a different messenger, but I had the same issue. So I logged into my T-mobile account, and there were detailed step by step instructions on how to do it. Tech support should also be able to help. Tell them you need help configuring your APNs. I've had to do similar with other unlocked phones before. It's such an easy fix but a lot of consumers don't know what to do.
Had same problem. Could send texts but could not receive text. So I switch to a different phone
I read a review online that if you installed a 4G sim card (from a previous phone) this is what causes that issue. It is recommended that you buy a new 5G sim card

question: Wifi - how to setup wifi calling? on one ace 5 g cell phone

answers.answer:
Wifi calling is dependent on the carrier. If they support it with this device the steps would be as follows: From a Home screen, navigate: Phone icon Phone icon > Menu icon Menu (upper-right) > Settings.Note If unavailable, swipe up from the middle to display all apps then tap Phone.Tap Calls then tap Wi-Fi Calling…
        
          see more
        


        Wifi calling is dependent on the carrier. If they support it with this device the steps would be as follows: From a Home screen, navigate: Phone icon Phone icon > Menu icon Menu (upper-right) > Settings.Note If unavailable, swipe up from the middle to display all apps then tap Phone.Tap Calls then tap Wi-Fi Calling.Tap the Wi-Fi Calling switch to turn on Switch on or off Switch off.Note If turning off, tap Turn off WI-FI calling when prompted.Note If activating Wi-Fi Calling for the first time:Review the Terms & Conditions then tap CONTINUE to proceed.Note Ensure the Terms & Conditions option is checked Checkmark.Enter the emergency location info (E911) address then tap SAVE.Caution This info gets transmitted to the emergency dispatcher for all 911 Wi-Fi calls. If address validation fails, you'll be required to re-enter a valid address.
        
          see less

Thank you for your inquiry regarding our product. Wifi Calling is a feature that can be set up by your carrier. It would be best to contact them first to see if this can be added to the device. - Frank

question: I brought one for my sister and the battery just died.  Can I buy a new battery?

answers.answer:
Seek out a service tech if it's still under warranty. It may not be the battery. Typically the battery should last 5 years or longer. Unfortunately, this battery is non removable/non replaceable. Here's a few suggestions if you suspect it is the battery. (1) Try another charger. A non-removable battery phone not chargi…
        
          see more
        


        Seek out a service tech if it's still under warranty. It may not be the battery. Typically the battery should last 5 years or longer. Unfortunately, this battery is non removable/non replaceable. Here's a few suggestions if you suspect it is the battery. (1) Try another charger. A non-removable battery phone not charging could be a result of damage or an incompatible charger. (2) Try charging it overnight if you haven't already. (3) Inspect the charging port. Sometimes it may contain moisture or lint. You can try cleaning it by blowing dry air into the port or using a tiny object to remove the dirt. The blow dryer at a hotter setting will also help to remove and dry any trapped moisture inside the charging port. Afterwards let it dry overnight.(4)Once that's completed, try doing a forced restart of the phone. -- Plug in your phone with the charger.-- Press and hold the power button for at least 10-15 seconds. Finally, if all else fails some claim the battery compartment can be accessible by some trained techs but it's not a service recommended by Motorola. ~ Good Luck
        
          see less

Thank you for reaching out to us. The battery of Moto One 5G Ace is non-removable. We suggest having the device repaired, you can find your repair options on this link: https://motorola-global-portal.custhelp.com/app/repair-faqs

MSRP prices are similar on both phones  and the final price you pay depends on the incentives being offered by the different sellers. question: Is this phone compatible with Visible?

answers.answer:
Visible is a Verizon sub-brand and not a Verizon MVNO. That is very important to point out.         Visible is a Verizon sub-brand and not a Verizon MVNO. That is very important to point out. Until Verizon completes their rollout of HD Voice (VoLTE) to all of their Visible customers which has been lagging behind as compared to their rollout to their main Verizon customers, Today anyone who uses the Visible IMEI phone tool to check a Motorola device for compatibility is going to receive an incompatible response. The fact is that Verizon is discontinuing 3G and only universally supporting 4G in CDMA without VoLTE until 12/31/22. The rollout of VoLTE including 5G for Visible customers is currently behind schedule. Consequently this means that Verizon is erroring on the safe side in TEMPORARILY declining new customers to Visible as they want to be assured that both voice and data support will work successfully across all zip codes in their network. On the other hand, If you use the compatibility tool at the main Verizon website the response will show compatible when connected to VoLTE. Even in the past when Visible issued service on 4G Motorola phones they used to include a disclosure that read "all features of a phone may not be available with their service." In conclusion. If you've already purchased this phone you can still request a SIM card from Visible and your phone may still work. Their higher priced parent company Verizon still remains a valid option to also consider immediately. I realize how confusing this may sound but seriously I'm just being honest with you. My understanding is that this is a temporary situation.
        
          see less

question: Why is Motorola dishonest when they say the phone is 5g, when it's 5g only for a certain network?

answers.answer:
The Motorola One 5G Ace (2021) is fully 5G compliant. The carrier compatibility chart at the Motorola corporate site is not to be misconstrued as a list promising full 5 G accessibility with every carrier posted . As widely publicized by the national media 5G availability depends on which carrier you get your device se…
        
          see more
        


        The Motorola One 5G Ace (2021) is fully 5G compliant. The carrier compatibility chart at the Motorola corporate site is not to be misconstrued as a list promising full 5 G accessibility with every carrier posted . As widely publicized by the national media 5G availability depends on which carrier you get your device service from. For now, T-Mobile is the only nationwide 5G carrier offering connections on its proprietary developed low-band network.   Verizon and AT&T offer high-band 5G hotspots (typically outdoors) in specific cities as they quickly and aggressive work towards building up their own 5G networks.  Motorola now and always has been fully transparent on listing which devices they sell offer 5G access and which do not.  Here's another important point worth keeping in mind.  Access to 5G with T-Mobile 's MVNO carriers can also vary as they continue to migrate Sprint over to T-Mobile's 5G services.  I hope this information helps to clear up any confusion.
        
          see less

Thanks for reaching out. Motorola One 5G Ace is a 5G compatible phone. However, please be advised that it is still carrier-dependent cause not all providers have this feature. You can refer to our carrier compatibility chart to see the list of carriers that are compatible with the 5G Network:  https://www.motorola.com/us/carrier-compatibility. - Frank

Definitely NOT Motorola being dishonest.... The phone is in fact , 5G !  Just bc only one carrier is offering 5G , means the dozen others that have promised to "rule the world"  with 5G these last 2 yrs , speaks volumes Abt the dishonest ones  that just quite get it together .... Hello Moto !

You need a radio app or a music a…

        I'm not sure what this is saying but I'll take my best crack at it.1) if you have a radio app installed, the bluetooth DOES enabled you to listen through another speaker device such as a portable speaker, car system, or another bluetooth-enabled speaker.2) Bluetooth IS NOT a radio. You need a radio app or a music app to play music first, then bluetooth can be used to play whatever you're listening to through another speaker device.3) bluetooth is NOT a radio tuner and will not act like a radio head unit for the phone. To listen to radio through the phone, you need another app such as iHeart Radio, Sirius, or a basic AM/FM radio emulator. To put it simply, enabling bluetooth allows audio to be played wirelessly to a separate bluetooth system such as a portable speaker, car system, home entertainment system, sound bar, etc AS LONG AS all devices used are bluetooth compatible.
        
          see less

        YES. According to the Motorola Corporate website under carrier compatibility it states " VerizonCompatible | supports 4G, VoLTE 5G sub6 support to be added later."  Motorola recommends Verizon customers who wish to continue using their existing SIM to have it "provisioned "  if necessary by Logging in to your existing account on Verizon Wireless and following the appropriate prompts---  Devices > activate or switch devices > activate.  Some Verizon customers have preferred to request a new SIM out of concern they may not be able to activate 5G and full text capability successfully without it. . Right now Verizon's 5G service is limited to even their existing customers. It's based upon their customer's zip code and regional areas that they call most frequently to determine whether 5G service is even offered in their  existing coverage plan. Reliability in using the Motorola one 5G Ace phone coupled with the Verizon network is overall "very good" and should only further improve once more calling regions connect to their 5g towers. That is, once Verizon's 5G expansion is fully completed sometime this year.  This may sound confusing but it really isn't.

        If Motorola Support is unable to help and the problem is related to using Verizon may I suggest the following possible solutions (1) Make sure APN is set to VZWINTERNET (2) Call Verizon support directly and asked them to add "CDMA-less provisioning" to your account and activate the phone for you. (4) Switching from an I Phone to an Android phone may require additional Verizon technical support assistance in setting up the new device to accept text/photo messages. I hope this information helps.

question: Was anyone actually able to get this to work with Visible? My imei says not compatible, and chat with them says won't work. Thanks

answers.answer:
Visible is a Verizon sub-brand and not a Verizon MVNO.  That is very important to point out.  What this means is that until Verizon has successfully completed their installation of their 5G network this phone would have to rely on 4G LTE VolTE and 3G connectivity to successfully work in both voice and data across their…
        
          see more
        


        Visible is a Verizon sub-brand and not a Verizon MVNO.  That is very important to point out.  What this means is that until Verizon has successfully completed their installation of their 5G network this phone would have to rely on 4G LTE VolTE and 3G connectivity to successfully work in both voice and data across their network system.  The fact is that Verizon is discontinuing 3G and only universally supporting 4G in CDMA without VoLTE through their sub brand Visible of which this phone the Motorola One 5G Ace (unlocked) doesn't offer.  Consequently this means that unless Verizon can with (100% assurance) know that their 4G LTE with VoLTE which they are also converting over to is available in your service area, they will state for (future Visible customers exclusively) that any Motorola device is not compatible when you use  Visible's IMEI tool which is separate from the tool offered at Verizon .  Even in the past when Visible issued service on 4G or 5G Motorola phones  they used to include a disclosure that read "all features of a phone may not be available with their service." In conclusion.iIf you've already purchased this phone you can still request a SIM card  from Visible and your phone may still work.  Their higher priced parent company Verizon still remains a valid option to also consider. However, right now with Verizon and AT&T both being the 2 major carriers in- flux undergoing network conversions,  I would lean towards  T-Mobile or one of their lower cost MVNO's as a viable alternative to Visible Wireless. At least wait until Verizon has fully completed their transition to VoLTE and fully installed their 5G towers nationwide.  I realize how confusing this may sound but seriously I'm just being honest with you.
        
          see less

Thank you for your inquiry. The Moto One 5G Ace is compatible with major US carriers, according to our carrier compatibility chart: https://www.motorola.com/us/carrier-compatibility. In the case of Visible, we recommend that you check with them first to ensure that this will operate on their network. -Rizza

        This is a totally unlocked phone.  This phone will work with any US based carrier, even those that were traditionally GSM or CDMA carriers.  Please note: Both GSM and CDMA are old 2G and 3G technologies and are or have been phased out.  That being said, I have 2 of these phones, 1 is on T-Mobile, a traditional GSM carrier and had no problem activating it and the other is on Verizon, a traditional CDMA carrier but I had to get customer support to re-provision my service to be "CDMAless" before the phone would fully work properly.  Please note: I have found some MVNOs (Mobile Virtual Network Operators) will not allow this phone or any phones manufactured by Motorola on their service, even though it will work with the actual carrier's network the MVNO is operating on, this is the experience I had when I attempted to move my Verizon number to Spectrum which provides my home Internet service.
        
          see less

We appreciate your interest in our product. This phone is unlocked to major US carriers. It would be best to check with your service provider what features can be added to the device. You may also see the list of carriers that this device supports: https://www.motorola.com/us/carrier-compatibility. - Frank

answers.answer: YES and NO.  According to the Motorola corporate website for the Motorola one 5G Ace (2021) it states " AT&T Compatible | supports 5G Sub6 NSA, VoLTE. I hope this helps to clarify AT&T's phone compatibility.

My wife and my phones were pretty much that but still called Consumer Cellular using AT&T towers in my area and with a few adjustments under the hood they both work fine.  It is good to call your provider so they have the correct IMEI number for your phone.
I have at&t prepaid and works just fine -calls, text, and data. Love the phone.

question: Does this have 3g or lacks 3g?  an att told me if thr neteork can detect 3g, it will suspend the line.

answers.answer: Thanks for reaching out. Yes it supports a 3G network but it also supports other bands: 5G NR: 2/5/25/41/66/714G LTE: 1/2/3/4/5/7/8/12/13/14/17/18/19/20/25/26/29/30/38/39/40/41/66/713G: 1/2/4/5/82G: 2/3/5/8 Also, even though AT&T will shut down the 3G network, the phone still works on its end. You can see the list of Motorola phones that will be supported after the 3G shutdown here: https://www.att.com/idpassets/images/support/wireless/Devices-Working-on-ATT-Network.pdf. You may also check this with AT&T for more information. - Frank

It handles the following bands. Any further questions would go to the carrier.4G: LTE band 1/2/3/4/5/7/8/12/13/14/17/20/25/26/29/38/40/41/66/71 3G: UMTS band 1/2/4/5/8 2G: CDMA band 0/1/10 2G: GSM band 2/3/5/8

I have T-Mobile.  Our neighborhood in the countryside has a strong 4g signal.  Occasionally, the 5G signal asserts itself.  The 5g signal in town automatically takes control as I get closer.  T-Mobile says our service is being upgraded in the near future.  It doesn’t really make any difference to me; I use WiFi here in the house. I read recently that 3g is being phased out as the towers are reconfigured.  It may then soon be a moot question.

It has 4G and 5G where there is 5G service. I do not know why a brand new phone with 5G would need to have 3G. I'm not 100% certain but suggest sending Motorola a message and/or go to their website to confirm.
Yes it has 3g

question: I don't get it. won't the 5g only work if service has 5g signal in area? what if it doesn't? how to tell in android if it's accessing 5g signal?

answers.answer: Yes, even though it is a 5G phone, you will only have 5G performance is a 5G signal is available.  If not, the phone will work on the best available signal.
The phone will show "4G" in the bars symbol at the top of the screen. I do not live in a 5G area.  I am assuming it will show 5G in a 5G area.

I have AT&T and, when a WI-FI connection is not connected, the "5G" symbol is displayed. However, as soon as I'm in range of my home router, for example, the WI-FI status is displayed and the 5G symbol goes away. This can be confusing ("Where's my 5G!?"...) but is as I would want - use Wi-Fi if available but "fall back" to 5G if no Wi-FI connected.

True it will only work if you have 5g in your area but the phone itself is comparable to some of the other high end phones available for a better price. Got mine thru Amazon warehouse for an even better price. I can't see spending a thousand bucks on a phone. Hope this helps

One alternative option to get your answer is  - Go to settings Scroll down to the bottom and click on About Phone /SIM status/ Carriers Name / You can see your signal strength in the "signal strength" and will confirm whether you're getting a 5G signal or just LTE. My other answer lists another option which might be easier.
Mine is always on 5g. I'm in Northern California. When 5g isn't available, it moves to 4g or less.

Make sure your device is setup correctly.  Please go to - Settings->Network & Internet->Mobile Network->Preferred Network Type.  If it doesn't show there then go to  "Advanced - Calling System Select"
Yes. I'm not sure how you tell. My Carriere doesn't have 5G.

question: How do you turn off the  5G on this cell?

answers.answer: I'm not sure if there is a way, but if you go to Settings > Network & Internet > Mobile network, there are two options: Preferred network type, which you can change to LTE/3G/2G, LTE/3G, or 2G Only. (I'm not sure if LTE/3G/2G will turn off 5G or not).The other option is Automatically select network toggle. This will force you to manually choose a network, which should let you avoid 5G networks, but you'd have to manually choose your networks.

The Motorola One 5G Ace steps can be found on Motorola.com under the user guide if you have additional questions regarding this device.  Go to the Start screen.…
        
          see more
        


        The Motorola One 5G Ace steps can be found on Motorola.com under the user guide if you have additional questions regarding this device.  Go to the Start screen.Swipe up from the bottom edge of the screen.Scroll down.Choose Settings.Choose Network & Internet.Choose Mobile network.Choose Advanced.Disable Automatically select network.The Motorola One 5G Ace is now searching for available networks.Choose the desired network.The Motorola One 5G Ace will connect to the selected network.The Motorola One 5G Ace has been logged onto the selected network.Return to the Start screen.
        
          see less

Thanks for reaching out. If you do not want to use 5G on the device, please try to check this link to manually select a network: https://www.motorola-support.com/us-en/?page=topic/network/manually-select-a-network/device/motorola/one-5g-ace. - Frank
You go into Settings and select Network and Internet. Then select Mobile network. Then you select Preferred network type.

You can also check our carrier compatibility chart to see other carriers supported: https://www.motorola.com/us/carrier-compatibility. - Frank

Wifi Calling is a feature offered by the carrier. This feature usually is only available for devices locked onto the carrier's network.  You will need to follow up with the carrier regarding the model phone to see if it has the ability for wifi calling.

I know you said T-mobile, but just some info, while the phone may have the capability, that is up to the provider if they allow that feature to work. I had Cricket, and they only allow wifi calling to work if you purchase the phone from them! I left cricket due to this!

Please visit the Motorola corporate website under software to learn of future OS updates. question: does this work with tello?

answers.answer:
Check with Tello regarding 5G support.  However, it works fine with my unlocked Moto phone which is a 4G VoLTE device.Here's the Tello official response as follows - Technically speaking, if your phone fulfills 2 basic compatibility requirements (and is unlocked) - it will work with Tello:1. The device must support…
        
          see more
        


        Check with Tello regarding 5G support.  However, it works fine with my unlocked Moto phone which is a 4G VoLTE device.Here's the Tello official response as follows - Technically speaking, if your phone fulfills 2 basic compatibility requirements (and is unlocked) - it will work with Tello:1. The device must support VoLTE (the type of VoLTE compatible with the Tello network).2. The device must support (at a minimum) the following set of LTE bands;Band 2 (1900 MHz)Band 4 (2100 MHz)Band 12 (700 MHz)However, for best service on theirr GSM network, your phone should have at least 1 of the following bands/frequencies in addition to the above 3.Band 5 (850 MHz)Band 66 (1700 Mhz)Band 71 (600 MHz)Locked phones will not work on Tello and they do not lock or unlock any phones later so this needs to be checked by you with your existing carrier or phone seller BEFORE you proceed with any SIM purchase.         #1- I havent tried other stylus' on this phone. Although there IS integration and apps within the phone that come with the phone.  I heavily suspect that other non-electric stylus' will work with this.  #2- Can the phone be sooner via ways other than finger print.  Yes.  You can choose to set a password or pin and open it with that.  You can choose to have no pin, password or fingerprint unlock, and just open it.  You can also choose to open it via double tapping the screen.  You can also shake the phone and it opens the flashlight.  Also, you can double push the volume down button to open the camera.  That's some of the stock stuff but I'm sure you can create many other "gestures" to get the phone to do what you want, including additional gestures to get the phone to open. This is a very very good phone, in my opinion.    Hope this helps.  Take care and God bless.

        UPDATE - Visible is a sub brand carrier offered through Verizon. It's not a Verizon MVNO. Consequently, it's still struggling with many of the connectivity upgrade issues Verizon was struggling with in rolling out VoLTE and 5G to their customers throughout the first 7 months of this year. Unfortunately, Visible services have not yet fully caught up with Verizon in all their service areas. In some areas, where VoLTE is supported this phone will work just fine but not necessarily always offering 5G. In other areas, CDMA with no VOLTE is prevalent and the phone may not work at all. This is why the IMEI tool at Visible may say not compatible choosing to error instead on the safe side until all these bugs are worked out. However, the Verizon IMEI tool itself will say differently and confirm compatibility Frustrating I know. Keep in mind most of Verizon's customers on their main service are using locked phones . Visible was their affordably priced gateway to supporting unlocked devices to attract new customers. The good news is that Verizon hopes to have this all ironed out hopefully by 1/1/2023. In the meantime, let's all just keep our fingers crossed.
        
          see less

question: Why would this phone, despite having just about everything else one could ask for in terms of features, lack NFC capability?

answers.answer:
It does also lack wireless charging which even today you can only find that feature in the new much higher priced Motorola Edge+ (2022) unlocked device. Motorola's rationale for offering NFC on one 5G phone and not offering it on another is anyone's guess. I can understand maybe why they don't offer it on their budget …
        
          see more
        


        It does also lack wireless charging which even today you can only find that feature in the new much higher priced Motorola Edge+ (2022) unlocked device. Motorola's rationale for offering NFC on one 5G phone and not offering it on another is anyone's guess. I can understand maybe why they don't offer it on their budget 4G Lite phones. However, other competitors selling their 4G Lite phones do offer NFC even on their budget priced models. Personally, I think Motorola's research shows their stylus phones overall are extremely popular with their loyal repeat customers . I think Motorola decided to wait to offer the NFC feature instead on their later Moto G Stylus 5G (2022) model at what they considered to be a more deserving premium price. However, only the customer themselves can decide if that price is indeed justifiable.

question: What is NFC, and is it a big deal to have a phone that has it?

answers.answer: Near-Field Communication (NFC) is a set of communication protocols for communication between two electronic devices over a distance of 4 cm (11⁄2 in) or less. They are used in contactless payment systems and allow mobile payment replacing or supplementing systems such as credit cards and electronic ticket smart cards.
NFC is the software that allows you to use things like Google Pay. We found out the phone did NOT have NFC the hard way when we attempted to set up Google Pay.

An eSIM is soldered onto a device's motherboard at the point of manufacturing while having the same functionality as a removable SIM. It has M2M (Machine to Machine) and Remote Provisioning capabilities. Remote Provisioning capabilities within the eSIM provides the end user with an enhanced customer experience when activating and managing their mobile device. An eSIM can select support for multiple operators of one device and multiple plans of service each operator prefers.

answers.answer:

That being said, I do not recommend dropping your phone. Treat it like you…

        If by black bar you mean dead or stuck pixels, neither is common. While the screen is easier to scratch, cracking a folding screen is not as easy as one may think due to its tolerance to shock, given the softer materials used to make the screen. That being said, I do not recommend dropping your phone. Treat it like you would any other phone, save for the fact that the screen can scratch a little easier (this is also not common given that phones are most likely to scratch in pockets, where the fold will most likely be closed). Keep your nails trimmed and avoid wiping the inner display with anything other than a soft microfiber cloth.

        I don't know about Lycamobile, but I do know that if you are a Sprint customer who is now on T-Mobile, the software of the phone doesn't register with Sprint.  When you give the IMEI number to Sprint to activate it, it shows up as incompatible-even though it's supposed to be unlocked.  After long calls to OnePlus, 1hr at T-Mobile store and with Sprint support, it appears the phone only shipped with T-Mobile compatibility.  OnePlus does have the software for Sprint as you can buy it directly from Sprint/T-Mobile (locked of course) and it works fine, but Sprint compatibility was not added to the Unlocked phone when I purchased it.  No choice but to return it.  Once Sprint is entirely gone, this shouldn't be an issue, but for now it is.

        Hi Steve, When  I received my phone, I charged it all the way and activated it. However, don't stop reading...., I have kept several of my old Samsung phones after deactivating them. I use them as mp3 players. I also use them to listen to iHeart radio. I regularly download apps on these phones without problem. As long as you're connected via wifi to a network you should be able to download and install apps. That's why I've downloaded player apps so I can listen to MP3 recordings while I'm away from my network (or a network), and at home I can do anything but make and receive calls on a non-activated phone. Hope this helps. Oh, and don't throw your old phone away yet. :-)

question: Can you buy minutes and use them until they're used up or do you need to pay monthly?

answers.answer:
You can buy minutes at any time if you buy a minutes plan. Unused minutes, data and texts roll over past the date. The date is also added on; for example, if you buy the $25 plan for 500 minutes, 500 texts and 500 mb data and sixty days to use them, if you don't use them in that sixty days, it rolls over until the sixt…
        
          see more
        


        You can buy minutes at any time if you buy a minutes plan. Unused minutes, data and texts roll over past the date. The date is also added on; for example, if you buy the $25 plan for 500 minutes, 500 texts and 500 mb data and sixty days to use them, if you don't use them in that sixty days, it rolls over until the sixty days expires. If you buy another $25 plan say, after 30 days on this plan, your 30 left over days plus 60 new days then bumps you out to 90 days, PLUS whatever minutes, data and texts you have left are added to the new purchase.  UNLESS, you buy an unlimited plan for $25 which is for one month only. Which you do not need to do. You can also pay the $125 for a whole year and get 2,000 minutes and 365 days to use them, plus GB of data and thousands of texts. Sometimes this plan goes on sale for $75 and it's a bargain.
        
          see less

However, Verizon bought TracFone last year, so they have probably been switching from AT&T to Verizon ever since and maybe sped that up in February when AT&T shutdown (or sai…

        The YES answer is wrong. I'm sure it was honestly given, but was based on their "history" with TracFone, which formerly often used AT&T networks. However, Verizon bought TracFone last year, so they have probably been switching from AT&T to Verizon ever since and maybe sped that up in February when AT&T shutdown (or said they would) their 3G network. I have had this exact model TracFone (and I can tell mine is using Verizon) since buying it recently to replace a 5-yr old TracFone (which definitely used AT&T). [We also have an even older 3G non-smart TracFone, which I understood to be on AT&T since I received a text from TracFone that it would quit working on 2/22/22, but it is still working!]
        
          see less

FWIW, the documentation that I've seen for this phone says it uses the Verizon network, which implies it won't work if the only signal you get is AT&Ts. What I do know for certain is that my old 3G Tracfone, which I just replaced with this one, never got any kind of signal at my house, but this Alcatel 4G gets at least three bars, and sometimes more. Hope this helps.
Hi Vickie Carver. Please be informed that the phone in question is a CMDA phone powered by Verizon. Thus, it will not work with AT&T network. ^Kathleen

If you order a phone from TracFone's website, the first thing you have to do is provide the zipcode for "where you will be using the phone", then the phones you will be offered are often fewer than all the ones on their advertising page. Therefore, I ASSUME you are only offered ones that are set up for a network that serves your area.  Amazon may do some version of that, too, but if you have limited service in your area, be real sure.

Yes, definitely.  AT&T is what my old flip Tracfone used.  By the way, this Tracfone Alcatel TCL A3 is wonderful.  You're going to love it.  However, take your time setting it up and download the complete manual online if possible because the condensed version that comes with this phone doesn't cover everything in depth.

The web is full of posts by users that bought a Pixel just to discover that if they want volte they need to root their phone or wait for Google (and they are waiting since the first pixel).  Every post opened on the Google community is quickly locked by Google moderators. If you happen to live in the 10 supported countries, than it's a great phone (as long as you won't relocate or travel to another country)

We're in Verizon now (is rather be on Google Fi). I notice the speaker phone volume is sometimes quieter than I'd prefer given anytime that I would want spea…

        This is a loaded question because you're milage will vary by network. When I had Google Fi, it was great. I didn't have any problems, but my wife did (go figure). We're in Verizon now (is rather be on Google Fi). I notice the speaker phone volume is sometimes quieter than I'd prefer given anytime that I would want speaker phone. The regular call quality is awesome, especially when you're calling in high-rise definition, where the fidelity is crisp and clear, and the background noise is cancelled out. The HD calls are "turned off" when it's Bluetoothing through your car, but when you switch back to your phone, the HD is turned back on. It's a pretty decent phone in most situations.
        
          see less
Thus far the sound and operation of the phone have been good so far. No dropped calls yet. But I am only 4-5 months in also.
I actually have two SIMS , each carrying a different number on a different network (Verizon and AT&T). Never experience dropped calls, unless it was dropped from the caller's side.

question: video quality is as good as in iphone ?

answers.answer: Kind of a loaded question. Out of the box, iphone is probably easier to achieve "better" video quality. If you like tinkering with settings, Android is almost always the answer. What you're not asking is "what's the life expectancy of an iPhone vs a Pixel?" Apple often makes their phones good for 2.5 years before it feels slow and dated. My last Pixel 2 I had for 6.5 years and it didn't feel slow until the last 3 months. Google takes pride in their phones. Apple just wants to sell you their next latest one and dazzle you with better specs.
My daughter has an iPhone13 and I find my Pixel6 video quality better than hers.
More tech savvy folks will notice a slight difference. For me, as a regular Joe, it’s as good as an iPhone.

question: Why is the pixel 6 (and 6 pro) only avaliable in what was considered xl in previous pixels? i was so excited to get one, but now it's just too big.

The Pixel 6 and Pro should do just that, especially with the new Tenser chip only made by Google. You might want to look at the Pixel 5a 5G with a screen size of 6.34" or try to get a 4a 5G which is smaller yet. If you switch to Apple you could get the mini which I believe is 5.8".
The Pixel 6 has a 6.4" display. To see the full list of tech specs, please visit: g.co/pixel/specs

The pixel 6 is actually bigger and heavier than all the prior XL models (twice as thick including the camera array).  Unfortunately it's thicker and heavier than the competition.  This is not a pocket phone, nor for use with one hand, however it has significant improvements in the processing and camera departments over previous pixel models (if you can put up with its size and weight).

question: Will this phone work with Cricket?

answers.answer:
You should verify that Cricket will allow this phone even if it is compatible. My friend has an unlocked Motorola phone that is 100% compatible with Cricket. I know which bands Cricket uses and which bands the phone supports and it is 100% compatible. Cricket is kicking the phone off their network in a few months anywa…
        
          see more
        


        You should verify that Cricket will allow this phone even if it is compatible. My friend has an unlocked Motorola phone that is 100% compatible with Cricket. I know which bands Cricket uses and which bands the phone supports and it is 100% compatible. Cricket is kicking the phone off their network in a few months anyway because they claim it's not compatible and they want to force customers to get new phones through them. Cricket and AT&T have never been unlocked phone friendly and have always blocked unlocked phones from being able to use Wi-Fi Calling and Volte. If they don't change that policy and let you use Volte with unlocked phones you won't be able to use unlocked phones at all after they eliminate 3G and convert the bandwidth to 5G. They might also decide to do what Verizon does and only whitelist some unlocked phones that are compatible with their network. If you are serious about using unlocked phones you should switch from Cricket (which uses AT&T) to an MVNO that uses T-mobile which has always been very unlocked phone friendly. I've used Mint Mobile for years but there are a lot of other Cricket type carriers that use T-mobile instead of AT&T.
        
          see less
Yes it can work with Cricket. Cricket is similar as AT&T.

question: Please someone tell me the difference in this and the tcl a3 model that is around $30 new? very difficult to find a good phone under 2.8" wide, frustd

answers.answer: There is no difference between the two phones.  The TCL A3 phone is sold as a Pre-Paid phone which is tied to a phone company who will give a discount for the phone using their network.  The A30 phone is sold outright which means you can go to any phone network company (ATT, T-Mobile, Verizon).

Please note that the TCL A3 is locked to a single carrier (e.g. Tracfone/total wireless). The TCL A30 is compatible with the AT&T, T-Mobile and Verizon LTE networks. TCL A30 is not compatible with CDMA networks (such as, Sprint).

question: What's the difference between this and the tcl 10 pro?

answers.answer: The 10 Pro has an AMOLED Screen instead of IPS LCD on the 10L. The 10 Pro has a Snapdragon 675 processor instead of the 665 on the TCL 10L. The 10 Pro has a dedicated night sight camera whereas the 10L does not. The Pro has a Telephoto lens instead of the Macro lens on the 10L. The 10 Pro supports reverse charging via USB (charge another device with the cellphone) whereas the 10L does not. The main camera is 68MP instead of 48 on the 10L.
TCL 10pro is a higher ended version.

question: Are there any cases or screen protectors available for the phone yet?

answers.answer: As of July 2020 there is only one 3rd party case and it's the same as the clear case that comes with the phone.
It includes a mobile phone case, and a pre-installed screen protector is on the phone.
The Tudia hybrid one works really good I've dropped mine a few times and it protects great. I do have a protective shatterproof screen protector on the front though.  Over all it's very well made.
There is a Tudia "hybrid" hard/soft case for it now.  Just search for TCL 10L case, it will come up.  There are a few others as well, but some look pretty bad.

question: What does unlocked mean?

answers.answer: It means it is an unlocked phone that is not exclusively tied to a single carrier. This phone is compatible with GSM carriers, including AT&T and T-Mobile. This device is also certified for use on Verizon’s LTE network. This device is not compatible with CDMA networks.

It means that the phone isn't tied to any particular carrier. But it only works with carriers (like T-Mobile) which use the GSM system. If the carrier uses the CDMA system (like Verizon) it won't work. Your carrier's customer service should be able to tell you which one they use

question: Help!!  when i plug the charger in, it flashes, spounds & vibrates non stop 'connected' to 'not connected' to the charging what can i do?

answers.answer:
We are very sorry to learn about the problem with your phone.  Please let us know if the following troubleshooting is helpful or not:- Confirm if there is visible damage to the charger USB, the charger itself or the charging port of your phone- Clean the debris from the charging port in the phone…
        
          see more
        


        We are very sorry to learn about the problem with your phone.  Please let us know if the following troubleshooting is helpful or not:- Confirm if there is visible damage to the charger USB, the charger itself or the charging port of your phone- Clean the debris from the charging port in the phone- Charge the phone with TCL official charger and cable for at least 30 minutes- Perform a forced boot-up- Try wipe data/factory reset  (Please make a copy of the information on your phone first before you do this)- Try the TCL official cable and charger with another phone to see if the issue persists- Try your phone with a different cable and charger with the same interface to see if it has the same issue If the  troubleshooting does not help, please contact TCL support for more assistance.
        
          see less
Is it still under the 30 day return?Either it's a faulty charging cord or the charging port is dirty or pins are bent.
Try factory resetting it .. I never had a phone do that to me before

question: Will this work on at&t after february 2022? at&t is sunsetting 3g in 2022 and they have published a list of compatible phones. tcl is not on it.

answers.answer: Sorry, we cannot tell at this time.  Absent more information, one should NOT assume that it will work. Currently, AT&T has NO TCL phones on its post-February 2022 compatibility list.  Just because a phone supports VoLTE does not mean that AT&T will white-list it and permit it to be activated on the AT&T network after February 2022.  The vendor must undergo AT&T testing for "HD Voice" support (AT&T's name for VoLTE) and pay AT&T for this to be permitted.  This is among the ways that AT&T limits your choice among GSM phones.
It will not affect the TCL 10L and 10Pro smartphone. As a matter of fact, TCL 10 and TCL 10 Pro will support the replacement of 3G.
Yes it will. It, TCL 10L (T770B), is listed as an Alcatel phone on the the AT&T list of devices that will work post 3g on page 3.
Yes it will. It, TCL 10L (T770B), is listed as an Alcatel phone on the the AT&T list of devices that will work post 3g on page 3.

The question now is does the TCL10L support HD Voice, You need a phone that is voice over LTE capable on AT&T.    The list has not been updated to include any late model phones 2020 which support VOLTE(most do). The TCL10L supports VOLTE on the ATT network. For $250 you can’t lose.

question: How is taking pictures in low light

answers.answer:
It is horrible!!!!  It is actually beyond bad. There is a cheat however that will turn the camera from crap to pretty decent. Go to the play store and download GCamantor. After you install it. It is going to say you have to enable your Camer2api (or say nothing and just seems to be looking for it)... It is going to see…
        
          see more
        


        It is horrible!!!!  It is actually beyond bad. There is a cheat however that will turn the camera from crap to pretty decent. Go to the play store and download GCamantor. After you install it. It is going to say you have to enable your Camer2api (or say nothing and just seems to be looking for it)... It is going to seem like it will not work.  Instead click on the data base and it will list a bunch of Xiaomi devices. Chose the Redmi 8 Note Pro (if it is in there twice choose the second one). You will know right away if it took or not with the next step. After you install the 8 note pro it will ask for permission to access the camera. If it did not take you will be right back to where you started. It will seem like you did nothing. This is how I know to pick the 2nd one if it appears on the list twice. Once installed you never have to go into GCamantor again. You will now have 2 camera icons on your device. One will be the stock camera settings (which will work) and the other will be like GCam (which will work also) and it is amazing!!!! You will now have night mode and all the other goodies that come with GCam. The rear camera by default will be 12MB when you switch it to 48MB it will seems to lag a bit and you will not be sure if you need to hold the camera on the target area until it is done processing. You don't, just take the picture and give it a second to process the picture (you will see a circle status bar) it is pretty quick. Maybe a second tops..... But WOW what a difference. It will now rival some flagship phones (yes even Samsung). Keep in mind that it will only work on the single rear camera. The other lenses will not be affected (the reason why it tells you to enable the camera2api, even tho you cant). So if you want to capture the hairs on a bees leg, you are kinda out of luck. You are stuck with the stock software. But all your normal picture taking, in any light conditions will be mind blowing!!! And it is free so what is not to like. Again if you don't, you will have sub par pictures that might rival another Made in China $100 phone.
        
          see less
Very good. Automatically adjusts on video as you go from room to room.

question: Does this work with the new Tello system?

answers.answer:
Here is my response from Tello- With just the make and model of the device, we cannot say for certain if it will be compatible with our network.Assuming you don't have access to the IMEI, then it is important you have a look at the tech specs of the device and check them off against the requirements listed below.…
        
          see more
        


        Here is my response from Tello- With just the make and model of the device, we cannot say for certain if it will be compatible with our network.Assuming you don't have access to the IMEI, then it is important you have a look at the tech specs of the device and check them off against the requirements listed below.In general, for any device to work with the Tello GSM network, just make sure that it meets the 4 requirements listed below.The "tech specs" of the phone you have (or are considering purchasing) will contain the information related to these requirements :1. The phone needs to be GSM-compatible;Tello Compatible BYOP devices include:– Most unlocked, GSM-network phones– Most unlocked T-Mobile, AT&T, Cricket Wireless, Simple Mobile, and Straight Talk phones2. The Phone needs to have the following capabilities;- 4G LTE compatibleand- VoLTE friendly with our network- For minimum service, your phone would need at least the following 3 bands/frequencies.* Band 2 (1900 MHz)* Band 4 (1700/2100 MHz)* Band 12 (700 MHz)However, for best service on our GSM network, your phone should have at least 1 of the following bands/frequencies in addition to the above 3.* Band 5 (850 MHz)* Band 66 (1700 Mhz)* Band 71 (600 MHz)For example, if the phone has bands 2, 4, 12, and 71, then that is ideal.The older your phone, the less likely it supports 4G LTE and VoLTE which is needed to work on Tello’s network.3. The phone needs to be unlocked.- If your phone is locked by the phone's previous provider, it will need to be unlocked by them before it can be used with the Tello service.- Our online device checker can NOT check if a device is locked or not.4. Device must be made for the US market.Only models manufactured for the US market will activate on our network. Message ends So this was their response to me.  It appears that the phone meets all these requirements but the optional Band 71.  That band is used primarily on CDMA networks for rural areas which may be of concern to you.  My only other concern is whether this phone will meet T-Mobile's strict  MVNO security update requirements and VOLTE friendly status to be included on their approved list.   I need a phone right away as I've been notified via email by Tello my older phone will stop working soon.  I hope this helps and I think I may take the plunge and  buy the phone. I don't really care that its camera not even close  as good as Moto phones or the battery life is also shorter.  I like the fact that the vivid display on this TCL  unlike Moto rivals OLED phones out there costing a lot more.    I just wish it was also CDMA compatible  to give me more options in the future.
        
          see less
New tellon system may or may not allow the TCL phone for its network. You can directly contact the Tello system for compatibility.

question: Does it freeze up of it you take many photos back to back?

answers.answer: It shouldn't... but, what's probably happening is that the operating RAM is being overloaded. That can cause it to freeze up until more RAM is available.  Remember that everything on the phone (that's running) is using memory; apps running in the background,  Google, etc. The camera, when used is taking huge chunks of memory at a time. So if you're fast shooting events, (considering each photo may be taking 5-20 mb, pet shot, then it adds up quickly) . So, theoretically, yes, if taking lots of photos in a row, the phone could slow down or freeze momentarily because the available RAM is full. Hope this helps.
Mine never freezed up, never froze up by taking many pictures
I've used the camera extensively and have not had any issues with it freezing.
The most photos I take are two or three at a time so I haven't that problem.
I took 50 pictures continuously one by one and I have no problem. Phone works as normal.

question: Description says works with verizon but then says no cdma carriers...which is it? thanks

answers.answer: 4G is not based on CDMA, so this phone will work when you enable Verizon HD calling (voice over 4G). Verizon is no longer allowing CDMA phones to be activated on their network anyway, and is shutting down their entire CDMA network by next year to make space on the towers for 5G. As long as the phone is approved for use on the 4G bands that Verizon uses in your area, this will work just fine.
Verizon is CDMA; however, per Verizon's own website, a GSM phone with 4G LTE capability will work on its 4G LTE network. A GSM phone won't work on its CDMA 2G or 3G networks, however.
TCL 10L works on Verizon (4G LTE network) with GSM, and Verizon already has GSM as its base network

question: Does anyone else have navigation issue ? My phone keeps showing me off the road always

answers.answer:
If your GPS will not work after everything you have tried, turn off Google Location Accuracy. On TCL phones, it has a tendency to corrupt the function of the GPS receiver depending on what carrier you use. TCL will offer an exchange for another phone that will only yield the same problem. If you don't do a complete ref…
        
          see more
        


        If your GPS will not work after everything you have tried, turn off Google Location Accuracy. On TCL phones, it has a tendency to corrupt the function of the GPS receiver depending on what carrier you use. TCL will offer an exchange for another phone that will only yield the same problem. If you don't do a complete refund and buy a new phone, just turn off "Google Location Accuracy." A technician may tell you to make sure that "Google Location Accuracy" is enabled, do not listen to this if it does not fix the problem. Disable it, and restart the phone. Your GPS should begin to work as expected with up to 12ft accuracy. I had accuracy as bad as 500ft with the Google Location Accuracy enabled. Be careful, googling anything can bring up a prompt that asks you to enable Google Location Accuracy, select no.
        
          see less
This is dependent on the network for accuracy and we have no control over it. It is recommended that that the phone be turned off and back on, so that phone is connected to the nearest cell tower.

The IMEI is unique to each phone, like a MAC address on a computer, and shouldn't be shared online for theft/fraud reasons. However, a quick call to your provider will let you know if the phone will work.  With the unlocked TCL the answer is most likely yes if your current phone uses a SIM card.

question: Plastic phone, does it seem like it would 'last' or flimsy? was looking at motorola g power too. tcl a quality brand?

answers.answer:
TCL (originally an abbreviation for Telephone Communication Limited) has existed in China since 1981.  They started selling TVs in in the U.S. 2013, and are now the number 2 TV seller after Samsung.  Their phones were probably developed from a joint venture with Alcatel (a French company).  They previously sold phones …
        
          see more
        


        TCL (originally an abbreviation for Telephone Communication Limited) has existed in China since 1981.  They started selling TVs in in the U.S. 2013, and are now the number 2 TV seller after Samsung.  Their phones were probably developed from a joint venture with Alcatel (a French company).  They previously sold phones world-wide outside the U.S. that were made by Alcatel.  They first released TCL brand phones in 2019.  Their 2020 mobile phones are respectable phones for a second year release -- I expect even better phones in the coming years.  They are targeting the mid-tier market, specifically Samsung A series.  They have a reputation of producing good value for money mid-level products and they provide good technical support.  They have an annual revenue over $10 billion with total assets of $23 billion, so they are not a small company.  It could be said that TCL is the equivalent of Samsung in China.
        
          see less

I've had this phone for approx 6 months, and it's totally fine. The build quality is on par with my last phone (Honor 7X) it's not amazing or anything, but it gets the job done. I expect the phone to last me about 2ish years, which is how often I typically replace my phone. There's nothing about the build quality that makes me think it won't last at least that long.
The phone is of HIGH quality and as a plus comes with a very strong case to protect it!!! As far as I can tell the TCL brand has come thru in making an excellent phone!!! Would highly recommend!!!
So far it's good. You will like it I promise.
